function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of readiness for pandemic waste management (WM1, WM2, WM3) in BREEAM, LEED, CASBEE, and WELL standards.","Impact":"Increased risk of uncontrolled spread of contagious diseases due to inadequate waste management.","Mitigation":"Implement specific guidelines and protocols for pandemic waste management, including segregation, disinfection, and management during lockdowns.","Technologies":"Waste management technologies for medical and household waste disinfection and segregation.","People":"Public health and sanitation workers, building occupants, and communities in general.","Owner":"Government health departments, building management, and waste management companies."},{"Description":"Minimal responsiveness to environmental resources indicators in WELL standard.","Impact":"Potential lack of focus on environmental efficiency and sustainability, contributing to increased resource consumption and environmental impact during a pandemic.","Mitigation":"Enhance environmental resource indicators and incorporate sustainability measures into the WELL standard.","Technologies":"Energy and water efficiency technologies, sustainable and alternative energy sources.","People":"Occupants of buildings certified under the WELL standard, environmental sustainability advocates.","Owner":"WELL certification authority, building developers, and environmental organizations."},{"Description":"Inadequate response to the comfort category in some standards, particularly LEED and WELL.","Impact":"Reduced focus on providing comfort and well-being for building occupants, potentially impacting mental and physical health during a pandemic.","Mitigation":"Enhance the inclusion of comfort and well-being indicators in the standards, focusing on noise management, urban farming, and local services.","Technologies":"Comfort-enhancing technologies, noise reduction systems, urban farming infrastructure.","People":"Building occupants, especially those in lockdown or quarantine situations.","Owner":"Standard development organizations, building designers and managers."}]}
